item.description:
There have been events all over the city this year, commemorating the 375th anniversary of its establishment.    To cap it off, the City, PPAC and numerous others are planning a party at the newly renovated PPAC Square on Weybosset Street.  Highlights:  Bakery Competition for naming the official Providence bakery, Food Truck Face Off, Fireworks, Art displays and performances by many local musical groups, and one burlesque troupe.

 

Given the large size of this public party, I fully expect that it may be difficult for people to find each other and stay as a group all night.  I'm going to try to be there around 5PM to start sampling from the Food Trucks, and find a spot for the fireworks display.  Coordinate in the comments prior, and day of give me a ring, if I'm outside of PPAC, I'll coordinate finding you.

 

Unfortunately, I can't find a webpage that gives the schedule that went out in email today, we'll have to make do with the ugly formatting below.  It is not clear if tickets are required for the events, or only things inside PPAC auditorium.

 

Weybosset Street Sidewalk
6:00 PM: Fireworks display by Colonial Fireworks and the
Rededication of the Providence Performing Arts Center
5-10:00 PM: Food Truck Face Off
5:30-7:30 PM: Providence's Dancing Cop
5:30-6:00 PM and 6:15-6:45 PM:  Extraordinary Rendition Band
6-10:00 PM: Gather Glass

 

Main Stage
6:30 PM: The Barr Brothers
7:30 PM: Christopher Johnson
Join Mayor Taveras in singing Happy Birthday to the City!
Results of The Official Providence 375 Bakery Competition
7:45 PM: Jeffrey Osborne
8:00 PM: Deer Tick
9:00 PM: The Minsky Sisters
9:15 PM: Area 401

 

Lobby Lounge
6:00 PM: Hear in Rhode Island and the Rhode Island Songwriters Association (Billy Mitchell, W.S. Monroe, Heather Rose, John Fuzek, Indigo Bethea, Dean Petrella and Buddy Cavaleri)
7:45 PM: Kim Thomas Band
8:45 PM: The 'Mericans

Box Office Lobby
6:00-9:00 PM:
On exhibit: Hope, Roots, Freedom, and Ingenuity: A Community History Project presented by Providence City Archives and The History of the Providence Fire Department

Lobby
6:00-10:00 PM:
Local bakeries compete for the honor of becoming the Official Providence 375 Bakery | AS220's Photographic Memory | Trivia created by the Rhode Island Historical Society | Multicultural Performances
item.how_to_find_us: Best bet will be to coordinate by Cell. I'll post mine in the "questions" section.
item.name: Providence 375 Birthday Bash
